DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study obtain efficacy , safety pharmacokinetic ( PK ) data follow treatment artemether-lumefantrine dispersible tablet infant < 5 kg body weight ( BW ) uncomplicated falciparum malaria .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy , Safety Pharmacokinetics Artemether-lumefantrine Dispersible Tablet Treatment Malaria Infants < 5 kg
DOC.criteria: Neonates / infant Body weight < 5 kg In cohort 1 , infant age > 28 day ; cohort 2 , neonate term age 0 ≤ 28 day Microscopically confirm diagnosis acute uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria mixed infection asexual Plasmodium falciparum parasitaemia > 1,000 < 100,000 parasites/µL Presence severe malaria ( accord World Health Organization definition ) Presence follow sign critical condition : apneabradycardia , sustain bradycardia , tachycardia , desaturation , hypotension , hypothermia ; severely deteriorate general condition ( base IMCI criterion sick infant ) Presence clinically significant neurological condition Presence clinically significant abnormality hepatic renal system Patients sustain significant blood volume loss ( > 3 % calculated blood volume ) past 30 day Patients unable swallow whose drinking impaired Family history congenital prolongation QTc interval sudden death clinical condition know associated prolongation QTc interval history symptomatic cardiac arrhythmia , clinically relevant bradycardia severe cardiac disease Disturbances electrolyte balance ( e.g . hypokalaemia hypomagnesaemia ) Presence ageadjusted clinically hematologically relevant laboratory blood chemistry abnormalities Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply .
